Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Binds to an ERR-alpha response element (ERRE) containing a single consensus half-site, 5'-TNAAGGTCA-3'. Can bind to the medium-chain acyl coenzyme A dehydrogenase (MCAD) response element NRRE-1 and may act as an important regulator of MCAD promoter. Binds to the C1 region of the lactoferrin gene promoter. Requires dimerization and the coactivator, PGC-1A, for full activity. The ERRalpha/PGC1alpha complex is a regulator of energy metabolism.

Alias_List.Alias: Nuclear receptor subfamily 3 group B member 1

Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with zinc (Zn) ions.

Interacting selectively and non-covalently with DNA of a specific nucleotide composition, e.g. GC-rich DNA binding, or with a specific sequence motif or type of DNA e.g. promotor binding or rDNA binding.
A ligand-dependent receptor found in the nucleus of the cell.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific domain of a protein.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with any metal ion.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a steroid, any of a large group of substances that have in common a ring system based on 1,2-cyclopentanoperhydrophenanthrene.
Combining with a steroid hormone to initiate a change in cell activity.
Any molecular function by which a gene product interacts selectively with DNA (deoxyribonucleic acid).
Combining with an extracellular or intracellular messenger to initiate a change in cell activity.

BioProcess.Detail: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.
Any process that activates or increases the frequency, rate or extent of transcription from the RNA polymerase II promoter.
BioProcess.Keyword: Positive regulation of transcription from RNA polymerase II promoter

BioProcess.Detail: Any process involved in the assembly of the RNA polymerase II preinitiation complex (PIC) at an RNA polymerase II promoter region of a DNA template, resulting in the subsequent synthesis of RNA from that promoter. The initiation phase includes PIC assembly and the formation of the first few bonds in the RNA chain, including abortive initiation, which occurs when the first few nucleotides are repeatedly synthesized and then released. Promoter clearance, or release, is the transition between the initiation and elongation phases of transcription.
BioProcess.Keyword: Transcription initiation from RNA polymerase II promoter

BioProcess.Detail: The cellular synthesis of either RNA on a template of DNA or DNA on a template of RNA.

PDB.Author: Kallen, J., et al.

PDB.PubMed_Title: Communication between the ERR{alpha} Homodimer Interface and the PGC-1{alpha} Binding Surface via the Helix 8-9 Loop.
PDB.Author: Greschik, H., et al.

PDB.PDB_Title: Estrogen Related Receptor alpha in Complex with an Ether Based Ligand
PDB.PubMed_Title: Development of Diaryl Ether based ligands for Estrogen Related Receptor alpha as Potential Anti-Diabetic Agents.

PDB.PDB_Title: Crystal Structure of Human Estrogen-Related Receptor alpha in Complex with a Synthetic Inverse Agonist reveals its Novel Molecular Mechanism

PDB.Author: Kallen, J., et al.
